lead_paragraph: Some Canadian voters are rethinking the ownership of natural resources.

headline.main: In Alberta, Oil, Cowboys … and Liberalism?

snippet: Some Canadian voters are rethinking the ownership of natural resources.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Russell Cobb reflects on political changes in Alberta, Canada, heart of nation's oil industry that has often been compared to Texas; argues success of New Democrats in province has given rise to greater public ownership of natural resources in the form of higher corporate taxes; holds while conservatives still hold sway, there is now a plurality of voices that American oil states would do well to emulate.
